website_summaries.verdict: An official regulation size lacrosse goal. Built from durable solid fiber glass poles with tough 5 millimeters netting making for a sturdy and portable goal.
pros: This 6-foot regulation size goal is ideal for serious practice or matches
Folds down easily into a portable triangle
Poles made from solid fiberglass, with metal u-joints and a strong 5-millimeter netting
cons: Can fold in very high winds

customer_reviews.title: Too big to fit in any car or SUV
customer_reviews.text: Unless you drive a pickup truck, these should not be considered foldable as once folded they don’t fit in any SUV or car. The entire reason I got these is because they were supposed to be foldable and so now they are useless to me. The folded size is a 6 foot equilateral triangle - buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Trin

customer_reviews.title: Ideal little goal for small yards, small players
customer_reviews.text: I looked at other lacrosse goals for my son, but this one turned out to be the perfect fit. We got the smaller goal for storage reasons (and increased accuracy, I told him!) Assembling it was SO much simpler than other goals, and we had it unboxed and assembled and in use in under 5 minutes. It also folds easily enough that my 12-year-old can do it, and the enclosed bag is perfect for porting it down to a friend's house when the game moves, and also keeps it from getting ruined in the elements like a larger goal would have. Durability appears to be on par for cost, but I'll update if we find any unforeseen issues.
customer_reviews.author: C. Aleo

customer_reviews.title: This is a great goal cage for someone who needs to transport their ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great goal cage for someone who needs to transport their equipment a lot. I'm a high school girls' lax coach, and this is by far the most portable goal cage I've come across. After the initial setup, it takes just seconds to fold up it flat for easy transport. I use it when I coach private sessions over the summer. I'm going to suggest that my Athletic Director buy these for our indoor practice days next spring too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Champ

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product, easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: my son is 12 and tore a whole in the netting the first day shooting in the bottom left corner. Other than that he loves it, he set up the rebounder behind it and practices passing several times followed by quick shot. Have ordered a bucket of balls and side nets to minimize ball fetching time. I had my son put it together and he mentioned the sticks fit loosely into the corner pieces, he felt it would have helped assembly if they were tighter. other than that good product, get him out shooting!!!
customer_reviews.author: CDyjak

customer_reviews.title: fragile
customer_reviews.text: This product is not strong enough to stand up in the wind far less sustain the force of a Lacrosse ball being hurled at it. I bought a rebounder at the same time and was expecting the same quality. Unfortunately I was wrong. This is heading back to sender.
customer_reviews.author: AJamesS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap cheap
customer_reviews.text: The goal is exactly 2 months old, so 1 month after allotted return period... well, my 13 year old is quite disappointed because the metal is already broken. He tried taping it with his lacrosse tape, no go. It doesn't stay upright and they use another lacrosse stick to keep it propped up. So... Save ur $... because ..im out mine.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Great practice goal
customer_reviews.text: My 14 yr old daughter wanted a lacrosse goal in addition to the lacrosse pitch back she already had. I researched a number of goals and decided on the Rukket Rip it! because of the price and size. My daughter did not need a full sized 6x6 goal to improve her shooting accuracy. The 4x4 size of the Rukket is perfect. The goal is very well made, stable, and assembles easily. The fiberglass rods are strong and won't rust. We are very pleased with the quality of this goal and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie 1972

customer_reviews.title: Net came out of seams on 1st day.
customer_reviews.text: I will revise my review if I get a replacement that is solid. 2 boys used one day, and it came out of the seams in 2 different places. Seriously, after 1 day of play. Hopefully it was a fluke. No matter how good of a design, if the net doesn't work, it's garbage. *update: 2nd net was as cheap as the first one. It came loose from the seams on the first day. My son does not have a 60 mph shot, so obviously this net is poorly constructed, even if the design is good.
customer_reviews.author: Derick C. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: The most durable and rigid portable lacrosse goal available!
customer_reviews.text: We love this goal, our 17U tournament team is using this for our practices as we don't have a permanent facility for practice. It is easier to haul to practice than a full sized goal, although even folded this still is not super compact but the trade off is the superior stability and durability that makes this the best portable goal we have used. We have found even without staking it down the goal doesn't move even against the toughest shots from our high school juniors and seniors.
customer_reviews.author: LAXDAD717

customer_reviews.title: Great for portable use
customer_reviews.text: Great Idea...lightweight and portable.....folds up quickly....but to store in your car/smaller SUV you need to dismantle it.....but thats no big deal as it goes together quickly. Only reason not five stars is I have found it to wear quickly....some loose threads that cause the canvas to come apart in some areas. Customer service was excellent in that I ordered two goals....one came without two frame parts...they sent me another whole goal to replace it. So I have extra parts now to repair with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great portable nets!
customer_reviews.text: The 4x4 Rukket Rip It Lacrosse goal has been fantastic. We have used our nets several times for youth team practices, where regular steel goals were unavailable. These nets are quick and easy to set up and take down. They are light weight and fold flat, they easily fit into the a trunk and are durable enough to be underneath equipment bags. Using weights, I use water bottles, in the weight pockets really helps keep the nets in place while in use. I will absolutely recommend these nets to anyone who asks.
customer_reviews.author: Ron T.

customer_reviews.title: Great net for Youth
customer_reviews.text: Bough 2 of these for our Girls Lacrosse club to use during practice, picked up one additional for my son to use as portable goal. Unit ok for girls teams but my son shot on it twice and net started to tear at corner and fray. I am sure this is a great portable for youth lacrosse but you will need minimum 6mm net for high school or above boys.
customer_reviews.author: Total S.

customer_reviews.title: Love our Rukket!
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical at first but this product turned out to be as billed. After we got it together, we wanted to break it down to see if we could make it fit in the supplied carry bag. At first it felt like we would break it but it took the twist and fit right into the bag. It will hold a few balls and has straps for two sticks. My son already has a ton of shots on goal and we just got it. He loves it and if you love lacrosse, this is a must have product!
customer_reviews.author: B. gladden

customer_reviews.title: Innovative practice goals!
customer_reviews.text: I had used the Rukket Rip It! Lacrosse Goals before, and was wanting to have some of my own. Glad to purchase two of them, and was amazed at how easy they were to put together. The goals have flexibility which allows for shots to hit the goal, but not allow the posts to get damaged; really a cool product. So glad to be using them this year at practice when we want to do short-sided lacrosse scrimmages.
customer_reviews.author: petermcarey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent goal! It came in with the packaging banged ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent goal! It came in with the packaging banged up and open on one end. We didn't know if all the pieces would be in there especially the anchors but thank goodness they were. My husband put it together in about 15 min. because of the size. It is a lot bigger then the last Rukket Rip It 4x4, but it is great! My son really enjoys it and so far it is holding up good.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Stith

customer_reviews.title: Good folding LAX goal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son who is starting to play in goal. I wanted to get something that he could setup and move around himself (at 12 years old, moving the steel goals around solo isn't possible). This is a regulation size, but is much lighter weight. It also fold up easily so it can be moved and stored.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up, light and portable
customer_reviews.text: The Goal went together in minutes. My son and I have been having a blast with it. It breaks down and sets up easy and it is nice and light so this old man is not struggling to pack it or move it around the yard. I also like that when you hit a post the ricochet does not sail off into the distance like with steel posted goals. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone playing lacrosse.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID G.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy; good construction.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is straight forward. Construction is sturdy; and great for playing with my 6 year old son. The net does collapse and can be transported ... but if you're looking to pack it into a full car, you'll likely have to disassemble. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Buyin' Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly but lacks durability
customer_reviews.text: Updating review....Easy set up but my 11 year son blasted through the net on the 1st day. The stitching that connect frames through the net could be far better and is not able to really accommodate much more than a soft shot. For $80, I was hoping for a bit more. Updated August- After 3 months the frame rusted and cracked. This is one of the most disappointing lacrosse purchases yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Caravella

customer_reviews.title: Better as a 4x4
customer_reviews.text: We loved our 4x4 but this design does not work as well with a 6x6. It's no more portable than a foldable metal goal and it wants to lean quite a bit during use. We are trying to figure out a way to keep square. Let me know if anybody else has figuref it out
customer_reviews.author: Michael T

customer_reviews.title: will not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12-year-old lacrosse player. It seemed fine initially but after a few folds and transfers, the hollow tubing corners started to bend and eventually they broke in half rendering the entire item useless. We have owned the goal net for 6 months. Unless you plan on setting it up and keeping it in ONE PLACE, don't purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Birthday Gift
customer_reviews.text: Birthday gift for my grandson who is playing on a local high school freshman team. He loves it and now can get even more precise with his practice.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie

customer_reviews.title: Black Edging has Come Off All Around the Goal!!
customer_reviews.text: This lacrosse goal was easily portable and easy to fold; however, it started to fall apart after 5 months of use. The net first got a hole in the corner of it after my son shot a ball at it. This is not super uncommon so we were not very upset about that, but then the black edging started to rip off all the way around the goal. You can reference the picture, but when the wind blows, you can also see that it has come off around the sides (not pictured). It is disappointing even at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Vanzant

customer_reviews.title: Really easy set up and seems to be easy to fold ...
customer_reviews.text: Really easy set up and seems to be easy to fold down too. Goal certainly "flexes" but doesn't really move too much and would move less once its weighted. Its in the basement now (winter in Buffalo you know) but my kids can work on their game a little bit when they cannot get outside. So far so good. Hopefully getting it is the car will be easy which is the real reason why I purchased it, to transport it to a park about 2 miles from home. If so then I would give it more stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence B.

customer_reviews.title: perfect practice goal
customer_reviews.text: perfect net for a backyard to move easily or fold up again. as a former division 1 lacrosse player I have yet to rip this net so far after using for a year. Great price as well as lax nets can be very expensive
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: 6x6 strong, light weight, but not easily portable
customer_reviews.text: If you want a fairly strong light weight lacrosse goal that easily folds flat to be stored in a garage this is a great goal. If you are looking for a goal that easily is transported to practices not so much. Kept it because of it durability, light weight and I drive a suburban. Needs a few more hinge spots to make it collapse to more manageable size for car transport.
customer_reviews.author: Satterthwaite

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up to high school LAX shots
customer_reviews.text: The bad news: the net rips badly with normal shots. My son is high school and in no time the balls were passing through the net. To their credit, Rukket honored the warranty, replaced the first goal, the second goal failed the same way, then they gave me a full refund. I would only buy this for youth or you will have the same problem
customer_reviews.author: Allen Reihman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and takedown. Light enough that my kids can move it, carry it and setup and stow by themselves. Subtract one star for product description being out of date. The 4x4 no longer comes with a carry bag. During assembly had to stretch to get one of the pieces assembled under the sewn fabric and ended up with a ripped seam. Has not affected usage, just kind of a bummer to have a rip in a brand new product.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient Geek

customer_reviews.title: Light, foldable practice goal for lax kiddies
customer_reviews.text: A bit of a pain to assemble, but you only have to do it once. It folds up flat like a magic trick and is very light to carry. However, any kid older than a 2nd grader is going to tear this net apart. I would advise only using tennis balls with this net.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: 4x4 great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have tested this product and would give it 5 stars. I did my research and this is better built than those of the competition and because of that it will hold its shape better over time and will be that much more durable. It means a lot to me that I buy quality due the fact that my school provides no money to my program for this type of purchase and therefore equipment purchases like this come out of my pocket. So I don’t waste money on garbage. This was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good net, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Good net, easy to assemble, easy to take down and get off the lawn. Not the easiest to store but I've heard that there's a bag. Stakes keep it from flipping over. All in all, good. Frame material feels a little cheap but I've had no issue with it and it has been left in the rain and no issues have come from that. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jlachlan

customer_reviews.title: Great portable goal
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and practical. We purchased these to donate to a summer youth program held in Puerto Rico as part of Puerto Rico Lacrosse. They serve the purposes. You can rip away and they stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Esquilin Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great net but had to purchase a ski bag to use with the 6' x 6' net
customer_reviews.text: The 6' x 6' net does not come with a bag. I ordered a 79.5" High Sierra ski bag that fits perfectly. The ski bag came with a matching helmet bag that makes a great ball bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand for goals
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand for goals! So easy to put together, yet so durable. Easy to move. I bought this same goal for my kid when they first started playing lacrosse and it lasted many years. I left it out in all kinds of weather....eventually needed a new one bc the normal wear and tear on the net....so I just bought my second Rukket goal! With such great experience with my first goal, it was a no brainer which goal to purchase the second time around.
customer_reviews.author: sdd

customer_reviews.title: Very well built. Remember to keep the box.
customer_reviews.text: Like all Rukket equipment this is very well built. Remember to keep the box, if you want to store this off season. I tossed mine and regret it. Maybe I will contact Rukket and ask if they will send me another box :)
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: So far we love this net
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this net! My 14 year old put it together by himself in about 10 minutes. The only issue he had was, there were no directions, so while it was pretty obvious how it all went together, he had a few pieces leftover and he didn't know what they were for. We watched a YouTube assembly video but it really wasn't necessary. The net itself works beautifully and folds up easily for storage in our shed. It is still large when folded up, but it is flat.
customer_reviews.author: NYDragon90

customer_reviews.title: it can be broken down rather easily. It can go back in the box it ...
customer_reviews.text: Whether you are storing or transporting, it can be broken down rather easily. It can go back in the box it came in. However, the box is 6' long. If you have a SUV or truck, it is an easy transport. It is sturdy and is full size. The engineering of the net is outstanding; it absorbed all hard shots.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Burud

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!!! Take it to the beach. No probs with wind moving it at all in pretty strong gusts. Sand slows down bounce shots allowing a friend to play goalie with very basic safety gear. Easy one time assembly then springs open effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: anotherlamplighter

customer_reviews.title: Received in a timely manner
customer_reviews.text: Have only set up once, but will leave a long term review after.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product that is easy to put together and take apart if needed.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product that is easy to put together and take apart if needed. When folded down, it's big, but you can easily pull it apart and put it back together again if transporting it folded down isn't possible. We use it for our son (attack player) to shoot on our daughter (goalie), so it's perfect for us to take to a big open field and get in some work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great For practicing and conveniently portable
customer_reviews.text: It came with a critical piece missing- one of the frame pieces. Amazon prime is great about making returns easy. We re-ordered and hopefully it will have all of the parts Update: the re-ordered one is perfect- easy to assemble, can be folded down for travel or storage.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Budinich

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This item is beginning to fall apart after roughly 5 uses. The fabric that holds the corners together has ripped and the metal/aluminum "corners" have actually cracked in one section. This is a result of light use for elementary-age kids. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Harper Hulan

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and stnads up to shots
customer_reviews.text: Received this net just in time for my son's birthday. It did not take long to assemble which I loved and appreciated. My son was thrilled with the net and has been using it ever since. I have not had to stake it down for him to be able to take shots. I am very happy so far with my purchase. I am a little worried about how it folds down for storage. There wasn't much instruction provided and no videos that I could find on the website.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect backyard goal, not only for lacrosse, but for other games as well. For example, my youngest uses it almost exclusively as a soccer goal and both boys enjoy taking a turn in the goal working on their goal tending skills. So far it has withstood everything they could throw at it. It may outlast me...
customer_reviews.author: E5150

customer_reviews.title: Not so portable
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this portable goal is as described except for its portability.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D. Allen

customer_reviews.title: These are super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to assemble. They are light and fold up easy. Very durable. We bought a total of 8 over two years. (One was missing the assembly and contacted MFG, they sent a new net in two days)
customer_reviews.author: Tone Def

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for working on box lax. Also put it inside regulation goal to practice shooting pipe
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Portable Goal
customer_reviews.text: We use this goal all the time. It is so easy to put up and take down. It is made of quality material and has held up nicely. It is shorter than a normal lacrosse goal but we like the ability to thrown it in the back of the car and take it with us. These are perfect for beach pick up games!
customer_reviews.author: Nbennett9

customer_reviews.title: Great Lacrosse Net
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. Set up took just minutes, well made, with heavy duty net. Many competitive product reviews stated that the net had holes in it within a couple of days. Folds down for storage in seconds, so it is easy to store/transport. My boy loves it, has transformed our back yard into a Lacrosse field. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Holte

customer_reviews.title: Only 3 weeks of use and already a tear
customer_reviews.text: This goal seemed great at first. My 8th grade son, who is only here every other week, has been has been the only person taking shots on this goal and it is already ripped. Sadly, although it was only used for 3 weeks was delivered 5 1/2 weeks ago and it is only eligible for return during the first month. We are hoping the company will stand by its product and refund and/or return the goal.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Durable Light Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. I have tried "folding" lacrosse nets and yes they do fold but they are still extremely heavy. This one is light weight easy to fold and carry. A
customer_reviews.author: Top Dog

customer_reviews.title: We love this lacrosse goal
customer_reviews.text: We love this lacrosse goal. My kids use it almost every day of the summer. It easily collapses when it is time to put it away. Even my son is able to do this all on his own. When it is up, it is sturdy and does not fall over. My kids have really enjoyed having this lacrosse goal.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Grady

customer_reviews.title: Good net for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Much more durable than i was expecting and it folds up well. My only issue with the net is that when it is folded up, i cant fit it into my car's trunk or back seat (which is already carrying 2-3 lacrosse players), so i have to take it apart each time. Stands up well.
customer_reviews.author: JD in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Bummed no bags/
customer_reviews.text: I love the goals, but was disappointed carry bags were not included and I was under the impression they were. I have purchased two other sets that included bags. It will be hard for my youth coaches to transport then. *After a few weeks my 8 yr old broke several strings on the netting of 1 goal. He was using a tennis ball.
customer_reviews.author: kite

customer_reviews.title: It folds up nice and will travel well
customer_reviews.text: No setup instructions and I couldn't find anything on line about how to assemble it but I was able to figure it out. Took maybe 5 minutes to assemble and then the kids were playing. It folds up nice and will travel well. The construction of the goal seems to be top notch as well. Hope it lasts for years to come
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This product is not full size
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product. I bought it thinking it was a full size lacrosse goal. This goal is small and does no good for back yard shooting or workouts.
customer_reviews.author: keith hicks

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 4x4!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy to set-up. Exactly as described. Perfect for indoor and box lax. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: sforesi

customer_reviews.title: Easily portable
customer_reviews.text: Great portable goal that is easily folded up. My 12 year old son loves it after a disappointing experience with another brand that we tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and fun
customer_reviews.text: @5shadylax runs clinics and camps each week and this 6x6 Rukket goal is the bomb. Easy to transport and set up in seconds, it makes our lives easy to move from one clinic to the next and be ready for the kids to arrive. Thanks Rukket for great designs.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Stahlhammer

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but my 15 year old shoots balls hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Have gone through this and a replacement . Nice idea but my 15 year old shoots balls hard enough to rip through the netting so its useless in a week or two
customer_reviews.author: Bob Trottier

customer_reviews.title: Brakes really easily
customer_reviews.text: My brother and I set up this net and we’ve been playing on it for about 30 minutes and already notice two small holes in one huge hole. This isn’t for stronger players who will shoot really hard... More of for beginner players.
customer_reviews.author: danica

customer_reviews.title: something that could be portable and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Discovered Rukket at the Lacrosse Convention, and with a price of $129.99 I thought it was a steal. I've used a BowNet a few times before in practice and after a couple practices, the net had a few tips. When it was time to buy a goal for my own use, something that could be portable and easy to store, Rukket checked all the marks. Affordable, easy to set up and store, and well built, it has proved to be a really good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ORIOL BRULL

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and good value
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup. Hard shots off the posts will most likely go-in whereas they would probably bounce-off of a real cage but for the portability, ease of setup and price, I'm not sure you can do much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great goal but you need a truck
customer_reviews.text: Caution DO NOT buy the 6 by 6 goal unless you have a truck. It's a great concept and really quick to set up but it will not fit in mini Vans or cars. When folded down it's 6 foot triangle.
customer_reviews.author: "dave_myers"

customer_reviews.title: The 6x6 goal is high quality but not terribly portable
customer_reviews.text: It folds and unfolds easily and holds up to my 10 year old's shots. If you want to transport it, you'll need a pickup. It is too wide to fit into my Acadia fully assembled. Other than that, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: juanie

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Net
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to play lacrosse in our basement this winter. He likes the goal but within two evenings of shooting the net already had holes in it. Disappointed with the quality of the net. Will plan on returning.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: We just put it together and it looks great, love the portableness and ease of it
customer_reviews.text: We just put it together and it looks great, love the portableness and ease of it. Our only issue is that we ordered the 6'x6' one and it feels much more like 5'6" x 5'6" - - anyone else feel that way?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Needed a quick and easy goal for gym practices. I purchased the 6x6 goal. it is still large when folded down but I put it in the back of the truck and that works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 4 x 4 and 6 x 6 less then a year ago. Very easy to set up but cheaply made. The net ripped away from the top after about 6 months on both sizes. Next time we will just spend the money for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The guys had a great time in their mini stick tournament
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these goals for a high school year End Party. The guys had a great time in their mini stick tournament. The goals are well made and easy to set up. The guys played hard but the goals look as good as they did when we first set them up. Thanks Rukket, we had a blast!
customer_reviews.author: Robin D. Omeara

customer_reviews.title: Good goal. Came missing a corner piece
customer_reviews.text: Good goal. Came missing a corner piece, but the company quickly sent me one. I like that it can fold down for better storage.
customer_reviews.author: King of the World

customer_reviews.title: not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: goal was NOT sturdy easy to assemble one or two " foldings" and corners bend
customer_reviews.author: crjs

customer_reviews.title: This goal is good quality, easy to put up and take down
customer_reviews.text: We needed a portable lacrosse goal to take to a local park for my son's weekly private lacrosse lessons. This goal is good quality, easy to put up and take down, and easy to carry with the included carry bag. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie S.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It arrived early and is working very well, sturdy and easy to assemble. It was a bit difficult to figure out how to fold though from the paper instruction. We watched the YouTube video and it was very easy to fold. Also, the 6x6 is still big folded and doesn't fit in our SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great option to help improve accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Great product that if used, can help your player improve their shooting accuracy. My son is 11, so he shoots pretty hard. We haven't had any issues with damaging the poles or net because this product has been built well.
customer_reviews.author: 26.2ismycooldown

customer_reviews.title: I like the portability of it
customer_reviews.text: We received this goal a few weeks ago and my son has already started to tear the netting away from the nylon edge around the mouth of the goal. He's 14, so they're not adult powered shots. I like the portability of it, but wish it had been better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Curran

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kids were out the other day testing it out and told me that its exactly what they needed.
customer_reviews.author: jmholton

customer_reviews.title: Nice but doesn’t fit into our SUV
customer_reviews.text: Uh oh, not even close to fitting in my Honda Pilot.
customer_reviews.author: Rea Lin

customer_reviews.title: we love it. I coach youth lacrosse and this net ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, we love it. I coach youth lacrosse and this net is exactly what I needed. We practice in a YMCA gym during the fall and winter so this net is ideal. Light weight, highly portable, and so far it seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: bcnaranjo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not very “portable”. Breaking it down is a process and as a coach, I don’t recommend for coaching purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Wray

customer_reviews.title: Overall great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It's very easy to set up and very light to transfer. It does not fold down to small enough to easily fit in an SUV but it's so easy to take apart that it's not a big deal. I bought two of these I liked them so much.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. The net had holes and started to shred after two weeks. The quality of the net is very poor. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Pat L.

customer_reviews.title: Good goal
customer_reviews.text: It is flexible and I think it will last quite a while. Very easy to fold. The kids can shoot as hard as they want. Net has good quality to it
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made; folds up quite well. Easy assembly. So far a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Net started tearing after 100 shots ( my kid shoots hard). However, Rukket responded fast and sent another one out in a couple of days
customer_reviews.author: hikermiles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and we use it a lot for wheelchair lacrosse
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Easy instructions!
customer_reviews.text: I set with up with the help of my 7 year old. Easy instructions !!! and very sturdy :))
customer_reviews.author: traci rochon

customer_reviews.title: Built to Last.
customer_reviews.text: Built well and is really sturdy. My son and his friends love practicing with it. Easy to fold up, move, and store. Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.author: Tboanzs

customer_reviews.title: Great first time net for my budding lacrosse player!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 7th birthday along with his first stick. The carrying bag is awesome for taking this out to the park. Easy to set up and put away!
customer_reviews.author: Diego Mama

customer_reviews.title: but this goal is fantastic! It is super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I rarely take the time to write reviews, but this goal is fantastic! It is super easy to assemble. It folds up very easily for quick storage. My expectations in its quality and efficacy were surpassed, even for the price! My kids loved running plays with it.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: We really like the goal/net
customer_reviews.text: We really like the goal/net. The first time you set it up make sure you follow the folding instructions to "break it in" so that it's easier to break down. Seems sturdy and easy to store. The instructions are a bit sparse but the you tube videos for folding it up really help.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Holcombe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for indoor conditioning.
customer_reviews.text: Lacrosse goal is portable and easy to set up. Went on YouTube for better understanding on how to set up. Honestly not that hard to figure out though. Ideal for indoor conditioning, practices, and possibly games but we have no need for it for that. Kids love it. Takes up little to no storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lixie

customer_reviews.title: Should invest in a better model. It is not strong enough to stand ...
customer_reviews.text: Should invest in a better model. It is not strong enough to stand when the wind blows. I would recommend a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy thus far! We had multiple shots hit the posts and crossbar at the first practice and the goal held firm! That was my biggest concern. It's light weight and easy to set up. A carrying bag would be nice though as its not easy to find a 6' long bag.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Goozh

customer_reviews.title: Do not hesitate to buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Very good and portable net. It held up nicely during many practice shots. Folds down easily and back up just as easily.. The only issue really is that it does not fit into the bag as easily. You have to really stuff it in there and then zip it up tightly. Other than that this is a very good portable goal.
customer_reviews.author: PDUB

customer_reviews.title: The portable net works really well to transport and setup ...
customer_reviews.text: The portable net works really well to transport and setup took 10 mins. It held up well with lacrosse shots and did not fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: mphips

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! I originally bought a 6x6 bright orange metal lax goal for my son, but it was so huge and ugly, I returned it. These are awesome! I bought Great size for backyard practice and they fold easily (my son can do it himself!) I am so happy with these goals!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I love these nets. The little ones are great because you can fit them in a car. My only complaint about the larger 6x6 nets is that they don't fit in a car.
customer_reviews.author: Cjaxlax

customer_reviews.title: Forgot to include a carrying bag!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got my 4 by 4 goal today and it looks great. But the reason I'm giving 2 starts for now is that they said they'd include a carrying bag for the 4 by 4 net which I didn't receive since I relied on that when I wanted to take the goal around easily
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, easy to fold and out away (video ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, easy to fold and out away (video on manufacturer website shows two step fold) and although light weight holds up to hard shots. Exactly what I was looking for to place in our small yard!
customer_reviews.author: N. Houck

product_meta.title: Rukket Rip It Portable Lacrosse Goal | Pop Up Lax Net for Backyard Shooting | Collapsible, Foldable, Travel Goals
feature_bullets: EASY SETUP and START PLAYING WITHIN MINUTES: Solid fiberglass poles, metal u-joints and 5mm Rukket tough netting create a strong and rigid goal sure to withstand intense games.
LIGHTWEIGHT YET STANDS UP TO THE HARDEST SHOTS: Rukket proprietary flex technology allows the goal to absorb the impact of the ball, making it exceptionally durable.
FOLDS DOWN and EASY TO TRANSPORT: folds down in 3 motions into a flat triangle for easy transport and storage. Use indoors or outdoors, practice anytime, anywhere.
RUKKET 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE and outstanding USA based email and phone customer service for no-risk purchasing
One 6x6 (Official Regulation Size) Rukket Rip It! Portable Lacrosse Goal - with 4 Metal Anchoring Stakes
